meanings.definition: The revival of art and literature under the influence of classical models in the 14th-16th centuries.
meanings.sent1: During the renaissances, artists and writers were inspired by ancient Greek and Roman works.
meanings.sent2: The museum showcased various renaissances paintings and sculptures.
meanings.sent3: At the art exhibit, the renaissances section was so popular that it felt like a time machine to the past.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like a renaissances, bringing new life to the art scene.
meanings.sent5: The renaissances in literature brought forth a golden age of storytelling and poetry.

meanings.definition: A revival of or renewed interest in something.
meanings.sent1: The company experienced a renaissances in sales after launching a new product.
meanings.sent2: There was a renaissances of interest in traditional crafts among the younger generation.
meanings.sent3: The town's annual fair had a renaissances this year, attracting more visitors than ever before.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for gardening had a renaissances, leading her to create a beautiful botanical garden.
meanings.sent5: The renaissances of classic movies brought back a wave of nostalgia among moviegoers.
